title: Gateway Authentication box hidden behind other windows and cannot be switched to
author: MrJohanLieb
body_snippet:
I use Remote Desktop Gateways to connect to servers using mRemoteNG.
I have the "Use Gateway" setting as "Detect".
I can connect to my server and all is good, but if for some reason I lose connectivity and need to re-authenticate (also when the computer was connected before a hibernation and then starts up again) the credentials box pops up asking for my credentials to the gateway, but it does not show this on top.
You can at this point not switch to mRemoteNG when it is in the background.
Y...

iterations.description: The Gateway Authentication dialog is obscured because the RDP ActiveX control does not have its UIParentWindowHandle explicitly set to the main window, causing the modal dialog to lose focus or be hidden behind the application.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The Gateway Authentication dialog is obscured because the RDP ActiveX control does not have its UIParentWindowHandle explicitly set to the main window, causing the modal dialog to lose focus or be hidden behind the application.
Approach: Cast the RDP client to IMsRdpClientNonScriptable3+ and set the UIParentWindowHandle property to the main window's handle during initialization.
